intro: Elatostema longibracteatum, commonly known as the long-bract elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Elatostema longibracteatum has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage.
